events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving a collision with a streetlight at an intersection. The vehicle front left side sustained visible damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report, as it involves a vehicle collision resulting in body damage.
An agent specializing in auto accident claims was assigned promptly to handle the case and assist the customer throughout the process.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining the next steps expected in handling the auto accident case.
Customer was requested to submit police reports, photos of the damage, and repair estimates to proceed with the claim investigation.
The customer provided all requested documents including accident photographs, official police report, and mechanic's repair quote.
The investigation team initiated a comprehensive review of the accident details, verification of submitted documents, and vehicle damage assessment.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the collision was accidental and the damage aligns with the submitted claim details.
A settlement offer based on repair costs and policy terms was prepared and sent to the customer for review and approval.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the fairness and timeliness of the offer.
Claim approval was granted by the claims manager following confirmation of all document validity and customer acceptance of the settlement.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to the customer's designated bank account to cover the vehicle repairs.
The claim case was formally closed after ensuring the customer received payment and confirmed completion of all necessary procedures.
All claim files and related documents were archived securely for future reference and compliance with record-keeping policies.
